question: Which country houses "Soomaa National Park"?
explanation: Soomaa National Park is a national park located in the Viljandi county of Estonia. Soomaa National Park is an "Important Bird Area"; "Ramsar Wetland and a "Natura2000" area. This national park has the largest intact peat bog system in Europe preserved as wilderners and it joined the PAN Parks network of wilderners areas, as it proved excellence in combining wilderners protection and sustainable tourism development.
